thread.title: The Cool Hotel Guide: Batty Langley’s, London E1
thread.title_full: The Cool Hotel Guide: Batty Langley’s, London E1

title: The Cool Hotel Guide: Batty Langley’s, London E1
text:
Tom Chesshyre   
In the top suite of this unusual hotel, tucked away on a quiet side street close to Old Spitalfields Market, there’s a bookcase holding a book with a button hidden within its binding. Poke the binding and a door in the bookcase opens to reveal a throne-style antique loo. It’s just one example of the great ingenuity, combined with a sense of fun, that has gone into this 29-room hotel set in two buildings dating from 1724 that have been lovingly made over to resemble Georgian-style rooms. “Batty by name, batty by nature,” as the manager is happy to admit; Subscribe now
